That was the part that was just implemented last patch, our ppm rate was just set too high by Tukez from earlier testing that I guess was incorrect. It's already been fixed and will be correctly modeled in the next release which should be tomorrow.

#467SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Raijor
I've been keeping track of forums for the last few months and I finally got around to some simming myself. The thing that concerns me is Spec/Glyphs.

Before moving forward I'd like to say that I don't know how to link the codes/parses I've ran as I'm not very computer savvy so it's off a limb here.

With my current gear/gemming (Random Starks/AP/Haste gems here and there) the sim has shown me to have the highest dps when using LS glyph and flipping the 2 "free points" in reverb over to complete the 3/3 LS meanwhile in some thread somewhere Rouncer was speaking of how putting 1 point in EF and another in IMP SS and using a different glyph (don't remember off the top of my head) would optimize this persons DPS. My question is why there is so much variation between glyphs/spec when we're all following the same rotation?

Also, when I run EP values for my gear it shows top three respectively to be Haste > Crit > Hit. There hasn't been very much talk of whether trying to maintain a critcap would be viable so I'm wondering why even in ToC/ToGC loot crit values so high.
#468SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Levva
The reason there is so much variation is that it entirely depends on your gear, even small changes in gear can significantly affect your stats/spec/glyph choices which is why relying on EP values is a bad idea. Its far better to ignore EP values and sim out each choice. New tools to automate this sort of simming are in the pipeline.

To link your Sim results use the little # symbol above the edit window to add "code" tags into your message this will put your config file or results into a block with a scroll bar.

Are you absolutely sure Haste. Hit and Crit are your top three EP values?? It sounds like you are doing something very wrong if they are. I'm shocked if AP is coming in 4th.
#469SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Kc7vwc
little off topic but I've been trying to find an update for Expertise stats. Someone in my guild said in 3.3 expertise got changed & that we needed a higher amount.
The FAQ at MMO says 140 Exp rating. My in-game character sheet is at 124 Rating (29 Expertise), with talents buffed. But Rawr is saying I'm way over the cap but doesnt tell me where I need to be.

Where can I find the latest stats for this or how much do I want? (I refuse to use sims so please dont say to use it to find out.)

thanks

EDIT: ok, ive been told 140 rating needed, cool. The 124 Rating isnt affected by the Orc racial, but the overal expertise is. 29 with axes, 24 with maces. I'd have to stack all Exp gems to hit the 140 rating... guess Im just kinda confused.

#470SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Darkaeth
If I had to guess, did you include your Orc racial? I believe orc get extra expertise when wielding Axes.

And last I checked, as a dps, 26 expertise is where you want to be.

Edit: To clarify. You just want your paper doll to say "26". Ignore the rating. It'll confuse you. With Axes you get +5 Expertise. So you'll need a lot less expertise rating then say a Tauren Shaman with the exact same gear.

As a side note: The black window with results was giving me problems trying to copy it. Maybe there's an easier way. -.-
Also : My simmed dps looks a lot lower than what I actually push and what other Enh's are simming out. Am I doing something wrong in the sim?
#472SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
Originally Posted by Raijor
Also : My simmed dps looks a lot lower than what I actually push and what other Enh's are simming out. Am I doing something wrong in the sim?
Show me a parse and break it down so we can all see where the sim is "wrong".

My last Deathbringer had me at 9484.9 dps. That also includes the minor ancillary damage that occurs to the Blood Beasts from Magma Totem and Fire Nova. Simming out my setup from that day with the same combat interval shows 9800.82 dps.

Dps(e): Parsed vs Sim
Magma Totem: 298.9 v 300.31
Spirit Wolves: 567.5 v 390.45
Fire Elemental: 681.9 v 882.74

My wolves were lusted on one of the summons which explains the difference in their dps. That difference would be even more profound if they had been Battle Shouted as well (only one warrior for that fight and commanding > battle when everyone is already getting Might). Fire Elemental is still a work in progress with lots of fixes incoming so the dps from it should be more inline with parsed data with the next patch.

Biggest difference is just that the simulator makes better choices, faster then I can. It has me firing an average of 35 lightning bolts and I only had 31 (2 being Chain Lightnings). I was good with the Earth Shocks with the sim averaging 29 (rounding down) and I had 29. It has me using Stormstrike 23 times and I actually used it 24. Lava Lash and Fire Nova were the biggest discrepancies, I used LL 23 times and FN 25 times while the sim only used LL 21 times and FN 22 times. I was also unlucky in that Windfury procced 2 times less then predicted by the sim.

Overall the sim seems pretty much right on target to me, if it is inaccurate it would be that it might be overvaluing some things compared to what is obtained in-game. It's hard to tell due to how much RNG is involved in a small a sample as a 4 minute combat parse. But if you disagree with that assessment then, please, show us some real reproducible analysis about where the sim is inaccurate so we can work to make it better.
#473SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Fenris
Originally Posted by Darkaeth
If I had to guess, did you include your Orc racial? I believe orc get extra expertise when wielding Axes.

And last I checked, as a dps, 26 expertise is where you want to be.

Edit: To clarify. You just want your paper doll to say "26". Ignore the rating. It'll confuse you. With Axes you get +5 Expertise. So you'll need a lot less expertise rating then say a Tauren Shaman with the exact same gear.
To make it simple. An orc dual wielding (using 2) axes needs 105 expertise rating to hit 26 skill. If you aren't dual wielding you will need the full rating required to get 26, which is 140. The orc racial is really only helpful if you are using 2 axes; if you are only using 1, you'll still have to gem the full 140 rating to make sure your other weapon is capped.

On a semi-unrelated topic. Saying you refuse to use the sim, and coming here to ask questions, is a quick way to get you dismissed completely.

PS: Frost Giant's Cleaver goes in your main hand.

@Rouncer,

You use magma and fire ele on Saurfang? I am afraid to pull aggro on the beasts on their initial spawn, but I am assuming ranged dps pulls aggro on them pretty much instantly. Have you ever been melee struck by a beast though by using a chain or magma? And on that note, does chain hit them for the full damage, or is it considered AoE on them?
Last edited by Fenris : 01/01/10 at 7:05 PM.
#474SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
Originally Posted by Fenris
To make it simple. An orc dual wielding (using 2) axes needs 105 expertise rating to hit 26 skill. If you aren't dual wielding you will need the full rating required to get 26, which is 140. The orc racial is really only helpful if you are using 2 axes; if you are only using 1, you'll still have to gem the full 140 rating to make sure your other weapon is capped.

On a semi-unrelated topic. Saying you refuse to use the sim, and coming here to ask questions, is a quick way to get you dismissed completely.

PS: Frost Giant's Cleaver goes in your main hand.

@Rouncer,

You use magma and fire ele on Saurfang? I am afraid to pull aggro on the beasts on their initial spawn, but I am assuming ranged dps pulls aggro on them pretty much instantly. Have you ever been melee struck by a beast though by using a chain or magma? And on that note, does chain hit them for the full damage, or is it considered AoE on them?
It's 98 expertise rating not 105. You need your mainhand capped no matter what but there is no reason to cap the offhand if the mainhand is getting there through the racial.

Magma Totem generates no aggro whatsoever besides the aggro generated by being a hostile entity. Fire Elemental generates aggro that is attributed to the Fire Elemental, not you. Fire Nova generates aggro directed at you but as they are mostly immune to AoE damage the aggro isn't an issue provided you don't use it the moment they go active and even then it shouldn't be an issue as most raids are using some other aggro generating technique to pull them away from the melee anyway.

Chain Lightning hits the Blood Beasts for a full damage second/third bounces so that is something to use carefully. Which is why I only cast two of them in the parse I mentioned since having the MW stacks ready when they are close enough to get hit by a bounce but already have enough aggro built on something else where I'm not worried about pulling didn't happen that often.
#475SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Fenris
Originally Posted by Rouncer
It's 98 expertise rating not 105. You need your mainhand capped no matter what but there is no reason to cap the offhand if the mainhand is getting there through the racial.
Sorry about the misconception about the rating, I guess I wasn't as up to date on the topic as I had thought. But I do not understand this logic in the quote. Why does offhand expertise not matter? If you are using an axe main hand and a mace offhand, do you not need the 140 to cap your offhand so you do not have a chance to have your offhand dodged, or is it once your main hand is dodgecapped, your offhand automatically is?

If it is the latter, I sure will feel foolish. I've always been under the impression that for dual wield, each weapon required its own expertise cap to be reached.

#476SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3frozenhops
Go ahead and sim out a situation where your MH is expertise capped and your OH is not. I think you'll find that the EP value for expertise is significantly lower than it is when both hands are under the cap. Of course getting that OH to expertise cap would increase your DPS, just not as much as adding say more haste or AP.
#477SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
Each weapon needs to be capped individually but the EP value for the expertise to cap the offhand is such that it is not worth it. Axe in your mainhand, mace in your offhand, 26 expertise with your mainhand and 21 with your offhand. Expertise normally has an EP value of around 2.7 if you are looking at uncapped info. However with the mainhand capped and just the offhand uncapped it drops down to around 0.64 so why would you want to add additional expertise past that point?
#478SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Fenris
Originally Posted by Rouncer
Each weapon needs to be capped individually but the EP value for the expertise to cap the offhand is such that it is not worth it. Axe in your mainhand, mace in your offhand, 26 expertise with your mainhand and 21 with your offhand. Expertise normally has an EP value of around 2.7 if you are looking at uncapped info. However with the mainhand capped and just the offhand uncapped it drops down to around 0.64 so why would you want to add additional expertise past that point?
Luckily I have never been in that situation, so thanks for the info so that I may use it in the future. Just for my own clarification, how long ago was it determined that expertise was no longer a "stepping stone" stat like originally believed? Or better yet, perhaps someone can PM me the link to a thread or the page number of a thread so that I may read up on it further.
Last edited by Fenris : 01/02/10 at 11:14 AM.
#479SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
I'm confused by your terminology? There are no "stepping stones". There is just value. Hit below the spell hit cap is worth about 3.6 EP per point. Expertise below the dodge cap is worth about 2.7 EP per point. That means that adding a point of those stats is worth more then spending it just about anywhere else.

In the situation where you can have one weapon capped and not the other you have to re-determine the value of capping that other hand keeping in mind that each point of expertise is doing nothing to help the hand that is already capped.

If for some reason you ended up with a capped offhand (say you get that new offhand claw and have a mace) but the mainhand was uncapped the value of each point of Expertise towards capping that mainhand is ~1.9 EP which means it actually is close enough that it should be simmed out to determine if it would indeed be worth gemming for that expertise or just to leave the mainhand uncapped. Offhand uncapped expertise is only ~0.65 so it is not even worth the time to sim it out.
#480SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Cochice
Originally Posted by Fenris
Luckily I have never been in that situation, so thanks for the info so that I may use it in the future. Just for my own clarification, how long ago was it determined that expertise was no longer a "stepping stone" stat like originally believed? Or better yet, perhaps someone can PM me the link to a thread or the page number of a thread so that I may read up on it further.
It was determined quite a few months ago that expertise is not a truncating stat like the paper doll leads us to believe (I assume this is what you are referring to when you say "stepping stones" - us gaining expertise in .25% chunks on the paper doll). In other words, if you have the choice of having 139 expertise (1 rating below cap) or 149 (9 over), you are probably better being slightly under and not wasting those extra stat points, and using that for ap or haste or something. I don't have a link to the thread, but I promise the testing is on these boards.

Ive been running Sims with the different specs I see on WoL and WMO using the standard settings with raid buffs, and with my gear I simmed the best with:

20/51/0

and in a close second with :

19/52/0

Has anybody tried and simmed better with other specs?
#482SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Fenris
Originally Posted by Cochice
It was determined quite a few months ago that expertise is not a truncating stat like the paper doll leads us to believe (I assume this is what you are referring to when you say "stepping stones" - us gaining expertise in .25% chunks on the paper doll). In other words, if you have the choice of having 139 expertise (1 rating below cap) or 149 (9 over), you are probably better being slightly under and not wasting those extra stat points, and using that for ap or haste or something. I don't have a link to the thread, but I promise the testing is on these boards.
This is what I meant by "stepping stone" stat, yes. Thanks for the info.

#486SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Mc_Chicken
At the moment i have my 2 mana points in Improved Stormstrike, but in a 25man raid i never have mana issues so i could probably swap them both out without worrying about going out of mana.
(i have tried swapping one of them out and putting it into Reverberation before and still didn't have any mana issues)

But EnhSim shows that putting 1 or 2 extra points in Improved Shields and switching Lightning Shield glyph for Windfury gives me more DPS increase vs putting them into Reverberation.
Anyone else have this? or is there some reason why that isn't a good option?


Update!
I took the 2 points i had in Improved Stormstrike and moved 1 into Elemental Focus and 1 into Improved Shields putting me at 2/3 on Imp.Shields and switched Lightning Shield glyph for Windfury glyph.
I've only tested on dummy though and just had 1 test with the old spec with Imp.Stormstrike and 1 with the new spec, both 5 minutes.
With the new spec i had like 300 more dps, i know RNG probably played a big part though, so it's probably not that accurate, but i'll do some more testing, hopefully in a raid soon...
With mana totem up i was just about to run out of mana everytime before SR came off cd, but never ran out.
So in a 25man raid i would probably be fine by putting the point in Elemental Focus into Imp. Shields aswell...

#487SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3goropeza
I have personally found it's not necessary for two points in mana regen talents. I use only one point in Imp SS and I have never gone OOM in a boss fight since 3.3 was released whether it be ToC, ICC, or even Ulduar. I do, however, occasionally run OOM on trash mobs due to using FN and CL everytime its off CD, but even then its a very rare occurrence. I'm wondering though if Elemental Focus would bring me more mana then 1/2 Imp SS. Any thoughts?
#488SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
Elemental Focus is more mana returned then Imp SS due to how Fire Nova works with the talent. The reason you are running OOM on trash has nothing to do with your use of CL and FN but rather due to JoW. Uptime of JoW on trash is less along with less time on target so you aren't getting the same mana returns from it and that is why you are running OOM.

Hopefully this is something Blizzard will keep in mind when they drop us down to base mana for Cataclysm. With JoW and significant time on target we are effectively mana free but without JoW we could have some serious issues.
#489SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3kws0623
I thought that enhancement along with ret and hunters were all moving to focus instead of mana.
#490SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Stopokingme
It wouldn't make sense for enhancement or retribution to go to focus. Considering the other specs of the classes use mana. I'm personally expecting some sort of Agility -> Int conversion talent or something along those lines.
#491SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Jessamy
Originally Posted by Stopokingme
It wouldn't make sense for enhancement or retribution to go to focus. Considering the other specs of the classes use mana. I'm personally expecting some sort of Agility -> Int conversion talent or something along those lines.
You don't need to expect it, it's already in the game. Mental quickness converts 30% of our attack power to spell power. Our attack power on gear is being replaced by agility, and our spell power is being replaced by intellect.

Both the prot and ret paladin trees have an equivalent talent.
#492SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
Spellpower isn't being replaced by Intellect. There will still be spellpower just as there will still be attack power. It's just that there won't be any of it on the gear. It will probably still be present on weapons because spellpower there is the equivalent of the weapon's dps increases for casters but for everything else it will be gone. Easiest thing is just to look at strength pieces and apply the same logic to agility and intellect pieces. The strength pieces don't have additional attack power on them because it would be redundant as strength equals attack power. In cataclysm intellect will equal spellpower and agility will equal more attack power so it would be redundant for those stats to appear together on the same pieces.

Our biggest issues going into Cataclysm will likely revolve around

- loss of spell crit when we lose the intellect on our gear and how that will affect things like Elemental Devastation/Focus
- dropping totems "freely" when limited to a base mana pool
- JoW - will we end up dependent on that raid buff being present to be effective in a raid
#493SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3gunsmithx
I may be mistaken and I'll have to see if I can find it but I thought they said at Blizzcon there would be talents in the tree to deal with the fact we won't have Intellect on our gear in terms of regen at least so we won't be dependent on things like JoW. I also wonder if they might not have a talent to convert some of the crit we get from agility into spell crit as well.
#494SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3StormseerCS
I interpreted this post to mean that haste would improve our mana regen:

Haste: Will also increase the rate at which you gain energy, runes, and focus. Retribution paladins and Enhancement shaman will have a talent that allows them to take advantage of this benefit.

MMO-Champion BlueTracker - [BlizzCon 09] Classes, Items, and Professions

Has anyone studied the new totems for Enhancement yet? I know [Totem of the Avalanche] is designed for Enhancement, but using Enhsim 1.9.5.2, [Bizuri's Totem of Shattered Ice] is significantly better for me. ( 7893 vs 7906).

I know the motto here is "the Sim rules", but (a) these items are fairly new to Enhsim so I'm not sure how authoritative the results are, and (b) the BlS thread says Totem of the Avalanche. Rouncer suggested using both, but right now I can only afford one.

I guess another thing that might worry me about Shattered Ice is that FS is somewhat peripheral to Enhancement, and if they tweak it again, it might drop out of our rotation, whereas SS is integral to us. #496SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Mengus
There's already been a lot of discussion in the threads about it. SS is easy on the rotation, and also AP > for AoE vs. pure Haste. Longer term, you should probably consider both unless you cannot adequately keep up FS. Use one for single target fights and the other for AoE fights. You might be better off spending badges on 4pc and the trinket however, as the totems are relatively minor upgrades over the triumph totems.
#497SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Shammiewow

There's already been a lot of discussion in the threads about it. SS is easy on the rotation, and also AP > for AoE vs. pure Haste. Longer term, you should probably consider both unless you cannot adequately keep up FS. Use one for single target fights and the other for AoE fights. You might be better off spending badges on 4pc and the trinket however, as the totems are relatively minor upgrades over the triumph totems.
Well, I've been monitoring the threads pretty closely, although I'll admit I have a tendency to skim the ones that are primarily Enhsim readouts. You're right, though. The totem is a significant upgrade, but the trinket is huge.
#498SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Fenris
Originally Posted by Mengus
There's already been a lot of discussion in the threads about it. SS is easy on the rotation, and also AP > for AoE vs. pure Haste. Longer term, you should probably consider both unless you cannot adequately keep up FS. Use one for single target fights and the other for AoE fights. You might be better off spending badges on 4pc and the trinket however, as the totems are relatively minor upgrades over the triumph totems.
IMO the avalanche totem is a rather large upgrade over the lava lash totem. Lava lash is chance on hit to proc 400, SS is guaranteed and more so, as you stated, SS is always in your rotation, whereas you may miss a lava lash for longer than its GCD. On top of that, I have had the SS totem proc to 3 stacks in 1 single SS (at the very least it gets to 2 stacks in 1 SS. I dont think I have ever seen just 1 stack). So the way the SS totem is worded, is misleading. Hopefully this has been reported before though, and is already taken into account in enhsim. If not, should be.
#499SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Levva
Originally Posted by Fenris
IMO the avalanche totem is a rather large upgrade over the lava lash totem. Lava lash is chance on hit to proc 400, SS is guaranteed and more so, as you stated, SS is always in your rotation, whereas you may miss a lava lash for longer than its GCD. On top of that, I have had the SS totem proc to 3 stacks in 1 single SS (at the very least it gets to 2 stacks in 1 SS. I dont think I have ever seen just 1 stack). So the way the SS totem is worded, is misleading. Hopefully this has been reported before though, and is already taken into account in enhsim. If not, should be.
Can you supply a combat log showing this effect and exactly how you expect it to be modelled. We can then verify if this is what the sim is doing.
#500SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
Sim does two stacks per Stormstrike already. It was ticketed and corrected a couple of weeks ago, Fenris is just late to the party in it's regards.

Avalanche is a significant upgrade over the Quaking Earth because it has significantly more uptime. ToQE usually averaged around 73% uptime in my parses while Avalanche is showing around 98.5%.
#501SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Fenris
Originally Posted by Levva
Can you supply a combat log showing this effect and exactly how you expect it to be modelled. We can then verify if this is what the sim is doing.
Testing it right now, I will edit this post when I get the results you/we are after.
My belief is that since SS forces you to use both weapons, you are guaranteed at least 2 charges every time, and if you get a WF proc off the SS that is when you get your 3rd charge.

Edit: never mind, seems I am late to the party as per usual. rouncer: 300 heavyhands: 0.
Was unable to reenact the 3stacks in 1 SS. Chances are the buff was falling off as I SS'd, refreshing it at the last .second but making it look like it was a first proc. At any rate, made myself look like a fool publicly again.

#502SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Cobs
With Black bruise coming out tonight, what do we need to find out about it's proc mechanics for the simulator? Off the top of my head I would think;
-Proc rate (believed to be 1%)
-Where the proc can come from (all hits, only mainhand hits, white and or yellow hits)
-Whether it is modified by E&M/CoE/EP
-Whether it is modified by spellpower (pretty much a longshot but in perusing some forums someone mentioned it might be so worth at least testing)
-Whether there is any sort of ICD
-A log of observed uptime in a raid setting
-Whether spells or debuffs are triggering or benefiting from the buff. (Pallies are seeing their Bryn'Toll the Bone Arbiters proccing the lifesteal off corruption application, jugdements, judgement debuff application, righteous vengeance application in addition to their melee swings, CS and DS. If Black Bruise followed this trend then things like SS debuff would be possible triggers, as well as shocks [including their debuff/dots] lightning bolts, flametongue weapon effect etc.)
Can anyone think of more to test or how to test these? I know some or all of these have been tested on the PTR but things may have changed before live.
#503SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3pintor
Originally Posted by Cobs
Black Bruise Testing.
I just posted about this haha.

Black bruise

Aside from a standard test (1 hour naked except the weapon (no enchant) on a level 60 dummy, no procs, no buffs, no damage other than auto-swing and no windfury), there are some key things we need tested that are enhance specific (again on a level 60 dummy):

-stand sideways to the dummy and stormstrike 200 times with no weapon imbues (or until you get a proc)
-put on your offhand and stand sideways to the dummy then lava lash ~200 times with no weapon imbues (or until you get a proc)
-Have a warlock friend keep CoE up on the dummy and test naked (except BB) for 10 minutes
-Have a rogue or warrior keep up sunder/expose armor on the dummy and test naked (except BB) for 10 minutes
-Test with your full gear and rotation for 10 minutes on the heroic level dummy (make sure no one else is around!)
-Duel a disc priest and auto-attack while they keep up their absorption shields
#504SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
Also need to compare proc rates when you have an offhand equipped and when you don't have one equipped (equip a shield).

Also need to see if it can proc from Flametongue, so imbue the weapon and (wearing a shield) autoattack the level 60 dummy for awhile to compare the proc rate.
#505SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Cobs
Originally Posted by pintor
-put on your offhand and stand sideways to the dummy then lava lash ~200 times with no weapon imbues (or until you get a proc)
I'm not sure how accurate timestamps and logs are for concurrent events but I'm very curious if A) both hits have a chance to proc the effect and B) whether the SS debuff has a chance to proc the effect similar to the Bryntroll "bug" pallies are seeing with debuff placers from melee swings. unfortunately the only way to conclusively prove the debuff effect does is if you see a triple proc from a single SS or have a huge sample size and saw three times the proc rates on SS than on a naked 1handed test.

The reason I bring up timestamps and logs is I'm wondering if they are accurate enough that a case of

Storm Strike Cast.
Mainhand hit for 2000.
Offhand hit for 1000.
Dummy gains Storm Strike.
Hardmood gains Necrotic Touch.

vs.

Storm Strike Cast.
Mainhand hit for 2000.
Hardmood gains Necrotic Touch.
Offhand hit for 1000.
Dummy gains Storm Strike.

Whether examples of these 2 cases would prove the debuff proccing the effect.

Black Bruise Parses

Looking at his parses the proc appears to have a wide range of effectiveness which lines up with the idea that it is an exceptionally low percentage proc. His dps ranges from 54 to 97 when looking at single target encounters with high uptimes. Loading the weapon into EnhSim (without the proc), then manually adding in 97dps and then comparing it to my 245 axe is showing Black Bruise as a definitive downgrade. Basically if no one else wants it you should pick it up and then move it straight to your bank, don't even waste the gold enchanting it, and hope that Blizzard significantly buffs it and soon.

#510SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Extenze
edit: Doing some more tests.
#511SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
Originally Posted by Orrion
Oh, uh, Pin.. we can't put Black Bruise in the offhand and do a Lava Lash test. It's Main Hand only. I'll do a Stormstrike test though.
The reason we want the Lava Lash test is that it is an easy way to see if the effect procs from any melee attack, even ones originating with the offhand.

Just stand sideways to the Dummy so autoattacks are not doing anything and start Lava Lashing. If you get a single proc you can stop or if you get to 200 Lava Lashes without a proc you can stop as either condition tells us what we need to know about Lava Lash.

That's also why I requested a comparison test with a shield equipped in the offhand, to see if it is proccing from melee attacks from either hand or only melee attacks from the mainhand + mainhand specials or mainhand melee attacks + all specials. The Lava Lash test gives us an answer on offhand specials and the shield test (while requiring a lot more data to draw a proper conclusion) tells us about offhand melee attacks.

Thanks to everyone who is doing this testing for us.

[07:59:12.186] Sometimes gains Necrotic Touch from Sometimes

Which by the way is a suggestion to others. YES we want your ideas for improvements to the sim but PLEASE don't send them as Private Messages to myself, I had 2 of them in last 48 hours. PLEASE use the issues thread to create a new issue, that way all of the developers see them and can implement it. EnhSim - Issue Tracker
#521SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
For an example of a good Issue Ticket that is leading to additional improvements and seems to have discovered a potential flaw in the current version's modeling see EnhSim - View Issue #5683: Support for LS2, LS1, LS0 in priority system

Please take a moment to look through all open tickets before posting a new one to make sure that your issue/concept hasn't already been noted previously. As an Open Source project, EnhSim is only as good as all of us working together can make it.

#525SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3GTtheBard
Originally Posted by Ghostcrawler
We're happy with Bryntroll for now. We'll see when the heroic version gets out there.

If anything, the other weapon procs need to be closer to this level.
Link to Ghostcrawler

Originally Posted by Bornakk
As a more detailed explanation, our itemization philosophy has evolved a lot from vanilla where in comparison to today’s gear it almost seemed like random stats were thrown together like everybody's classic favorite Strength and Spirit items. One of the biggest risks we feel like we face currently is itemization becoming too stale and predictable where the only thing you get out of a new tier of content are the current item with a few more stats on it.

Procs are one of the ways we’re trying to address this and we expect you’ll continue to see a lot more of them for the future. With any new feature, though, it’s going to take time to figure out which implementations succeed or fail. Also keep in mind that we know we haven’t always had the best track record with items that give up some of their stat budget for procs which is particularly true of casters.

We aren’t ready to announce any specific changes at this time, but rest assured we do intend to tweak the procs over time. This is a model you’re likely to see a lot more of in future content.
Link to Bornakk

Not to derail this thread or bring in insane amounts of QQ, but it does seem that Blizz is aware of Bryntroll's strength and wants the other proc items in ICC to be at that level. With the detailed feedback that the Enhance Shaman community provides to Blizzard, it would not surprise me if Black Bruise did in fact get a massive upgrade, as currently it appears to be one of the weaker proc weapons from ICC.

#529SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3SentinelBorg
In my opinion, buffing Necrotic Touch wont be easy for Blizzard. According to Josua's log, the additional shadow damage procs not just on white hits, but also on Windfury, Stormstrike and Lava Lash (he had 21 Necrotic Touch hits between gain and fade, while doing 16 white, 2 Windfury, 2 Stormstrike and 1 Lava Lash hit).
So it can be assumed, that this will also be the case for combat rogues. But because they do much more damage with melee attacks, then we do, the moment Blizzard buffs the proc to make the weapon worthwhile for us, it would probably become overpowered for rogues.
#530SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3DizRupT
Originally Posted by SentinelBorg
In my opinion, buffing Necrotic Touch wont be easy for Blizzard. According to Josua's log, the additional shadow damage procs not just on white hits, but also on Windfury, Stormstrike and Lava Lash (he had 21 Necrotic Touch hits between gain and fade, while doing 16 white, 2 Windfury, 2 Stormstrike and 1 Lava Lash hit).
So it can be assumed, that this will also be the case for combat rogues. But because they do much more damage with melee attacks, then we do, the moment Blizzard buffs the proc to make the weapon worthwhile for us, it would probably become overpowered for rogues.
While I doubt it happening, and easy fix (scaling wise, not necessarily code wise) would be to have it benefit from both melee hits and spell hits
#531SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nevets_69
Originally Posted by SentinelBorg
So it can be assumed, that this will also be the case for combat rogues. But because they do much more damage with melee attacks, then we do, the moment Blizzard buffs the proc to make the weapon worthwhile for us, it would probably become overpowered for rogues.
This is a good point, and one that concerned me quite a bit. But with the current state of Combat rogues compared to Mutilate, and Mutilate rogues doing just as much magic damage as we do, then a buff to this weapon might not be such a bad thing to bring the specs a little closer together.


Caveat: I don't play a rogue, never have, this opinion is based solely on the performance and lamentation of the rogues in my own guild. If I'm way out to lunch, please say so politely.

#540SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3jrfig626
Originally Posted by Fenris
Just received Black Bruise in our raid, I will be testing it after our raid in 45 minutes and try to get back the info you are looking for.

Can anyone suggest a mod to capture the combat log so that I can post it?
/combatlog

Then take the parse "C:\Program Files\World of Warcraft\Logs\combatlog.txt" and upload it to a popular site (worldoflogs, wowmeteronline, etc, and post the link here.

#544SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Synkronos
Originally Posted by Fenris
Sorry for the questions, but which combat log should I be parsing? "What happened to me" or "Everything"? This will be the first time doing this kind of test for me, so I've never used that /combatlog option before.
The /combatlog command will log what you need to the abovementioned file. It doesn't do filtering like the in-game display does. Once you're done just type /combatlog again to switch off logging, then you can go upload the file. After uploading, I'd advise moving or renaming the file (you'll need to exit wow to do so), otherwise any subsequent combatlogs will just append to the file.
#545SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Fenris
Originally Posted by Synkronos
The /combatlog command will log what you need to the abovementioned file. It doesn't do filtering like the in-game display does. Once you're done just type /combatlog again to switch off logging, then you can go upload the file. After uploading, I'd advise moving or renaming the file (you'll need to exit wow to do so), otherwise any subsequent combatlogs will just append to the file.
I really wish I knew that before I did the 200 lava lash test I just did.

Starting over. Will edit this post with the tests.

--------------------------------------------------------

Alright, standing sideways to the level 60 totem, naked only wearing black bruise and hellscream (245) no weapon imbue, only lava lashing. 200 hits later, I had only received 1 proc. The proc happened on laval lash #81.
WoW Meters Online - Combatlog Replay
I am fairly certain I screwed something up, so I took a screenshot of my recount as well.

http://img709.imageshack.us/img709/1...0710000932.jpg

I figured out what I was doing wrong. I was under the impression that doing /combatlog to turn it off reset the file, did not realize I had to manually delete the file. Working on the SS test now.

#557SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Stopokingme

#558SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Saanu
Originally Posted by Lchaim
Thanks.

I suspect this means it's BiS by leaps and bounds now since it wasn't far behind Herkuml and Whispering Fanged Skull before?
Assuming Herkuml War Token as a baseline trinket, the DPS gain for placing each of the following items into my 2nd trinket slot is as follows (using the most recently released version of EnhSim):

2nd Slot                           DPS       DPS increase

Empty                            8775.64         n/a

Whispering Fanged Skull  (251)   9219.18       443.54    
Deathbringer's Will      (264)   9213.25       437.61 
Comet's Trail                    9204.74       429.10
Death's Choice           (258)   9197.72       422.08
Mjolnir Runestone                9101.73       326.09
Dark Matter                      9099.26       323.62
Blood of the Old God             9078.95       303.31
Wrathstone                       9051.19       275.55
Keep in mind that these results were obtained from using my shaman's character sheet, and your own results may be different.

So, no, it's not "best in slot by leaps and bounds," but it should prove to be competitive.
#559SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Schahmaar
Actually, those numbers I posted partially seem to be not too reliable. Even tough I doubt that Blizz uses non-integer weapon procs, Rouncers estimate a few posts further is much more reliable.

So, I just picked my calculator, took all numbers I could find here and found a proc chance (in %) series for Black Bruise of:
2.7 2.8 3.1 3.3 3.7

I didn't really (and couldn't) check which abilities have been used, but anyway...from those numbers (round about 10000 hits I'd guess) we'll get a mean of 3.1 +/- 0.4 %. My (Fester)gut tells me that this smells like a 3% proc chance of BB. This is in general a very reasonable value, and I doubt a bit that Blizz started to use non-integer values like 3.5 or something.

So I'd suggest this to be a first good guess for Enhsim to see if us Enhancers should roll for it or not...I still have a big problem with those logs, though. I'm missing the "Shadow Damage" from Necrotic touch. I somehow doubt that it is included in the overall melee damage....but whereelse should it be?
Last edited by Schahmaar : 01/08/10 at 6:04 AM.
#560SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3zimeron
Originally Posted by Schahmaar
So I'd suggest this to be a first good guess for Enhsim to see if us Enhancers should roll for it or not...I still have a big problem with those logs, though. I'm missing the "Shadow Damage" from Necrotic touch. I somehow doubt that it is included in the overall melee damage....but whereelse should it be?
The damage is based on actual damage done. Since the target dummies were at 1 health, only 1 damage is actually being done, resulting in 0 shadow damage.

#562SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Cochice
Originally Posted by Lchaim
If the crit cap is going to devalue DBW, wouldn't it devalue WFS to a greater extent?
If we're sitting at it with no other options, yes. But static crit is a lot easier to gear around than a proc. In other words, I'd rather be right at, or a little above the cap with WFS, than a few % under with DBW and then way over with the agi proc up. I'm speculating some "wiggle room" with our bis setup currently only because it's still not set in stone, and won't be till we see Arthas drops. Once we see them, we can have a better list and know for sure which trinkets will be best.
#563SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Lchaim
Originally Posted by Cochice
If we're sitting at it with no other options, yes. But static crit is a lot easier to gear around than a proc. In other words, I'd rather be right at, or a little above the cap with WFS, than a few % under with DBW and then way over with the agi proc up. I'm speculating some "wiggle room" with our bis setup currently only because it's still not set in stone, and won't be till we see Arthas drops. Once we see them, we can have a better list and know for sure which trinkets will be best.
Good point. I also expect to see a lot of shamans swapping a point in Elemental Devastation to Reverberation, it's certainly easier than trying to move gear around.
#564SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Rouncer
Hothgor's testing last night was sufficient to validate the proc rate for Black Bruise as ~2.75% off of hits from either hand when using 2.6 speed weapons.

Issue I just realized is that no one has done testing with a fast offhand to check if the proc rate is actually a ppm model where it will vary according to weapon speed or a set proc rate no matter the offhand speed (mainhand speed being defined by the weapon itself). One of you lucky people with the weapon mind equipping a fast dagger in the offhand and doing 2k autoattacks on a dummy for me? If the proc rate goes down (should drop to ~2%) when using the dagger that changes the Combat Rogue aspect of the equation a bit.

(e) Sim is updated and functioning properly. Compared it's results for Necrotic Touch to values from Extenze's Jaraxxus parse from last night and they are consistent. Comparing some weapons shows it is now superior to the 245 heroic weapons from ToC but still inferior to the 258 weapons from heroic ToGC. Both 264 weapons from ICC10 Heroic will beat the 258s (and the 264 BB) but the 277 Black Bruise will beat those (and that is just going off the 264 version's proc).

So that works out to 277-BB > 264 ICC10 heroics > 258 ToGC-25 weapons > 264-BB > 251 ICC10 > 245 ToGC-10 heroics > 245 ToC-25

Basically the weapon fits well into our itemization now, even if it is nothing like how well Bryntroll works for Ret/DKs. Not sure we will see any additional changes as that may end up overpowering the weapon for Combat Rogues. Although that will also depend on what we find out about how the proc rate interacts with offhand weapon speed.
Last edited by Rouncer : 01/07/10 at 3:22 PM.
#565SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nevets_69
I did a 20 minute test using full rotation on a Boss Target Dummy just now. (managed to coerce one of the guild's ret paladins to come and judge wisdom for me so that I could support a full rotation)

Here is the log

It works out to 2744 hits that are eligible to proc Necrotic Touch, and it proc'd 91 times for a 3.3% proc rate.

World of Logs shows an uptime of 45.5% (this is what I was really after, for comparison with sim results).
Necrotic touch did 142 089 damage, which was 1.7% of my total damage.


I think where this weapon really shines is that the proc scales. Anything that increases our physical damage will also increase the damage done by Necrotic Touch.

So while Rouncer's current ranking for MH weapons may be accurate at current gear levels, it may not stay that way. Which just further emphasizes the need for everyone to sim their own gear kits in order to make educated gear choices.
#566SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer

Here is the log

It works out to 2744 hits that are eligible to proc Necrotic Touch, and it proc'd 91 times for a 3.3% proc rate.

World of Logs shows an uptime of 45.5% (this is what I was really after, for comparison with sim results).
Necrotic touch did 142 089 damage, which was 1.7% of my total damage.


I think where this weapon really shines is that the proc scales. Anything that increases our physical damage will also increase the damage done by Necrotic Touch.

So while Rouncer's current ranking for MH weapons may be accurate at current gear levels, it may not stay that way. Which just further emphasizes the need for everyone to sim their own gear kits in order to make educated gear choices.
It is possible that the proc is treating Stormstrike as 3 melee hits instead of 2 (one being the application of the debuff) as that would be consistent with what we are seeing with Bryntroll and it would even out the slight inconsistency in the uptime comparing your results to what we are seeing from the sim. Not sure how to check on that but if people keep running tests like that (longer = better) and it is consistently showing as a higher proc rate/uptime percentage the sim can always be adjusted to maintain accuracy.



My current ranking's thing wasn't meant to be accurate, it was just meant to show roughly where Black Bruise currently falls so people have an idea of what the weapon should be worth to them. It was also meant to show that the weapon is most likely close enough to the other options that it is unlikely to be buffed again so people should accept it as it is and not pick it up looking for another buff down the road.

[e] 70er dummy >< retard.....
So here's what I'm getting from this:

- From that log it looks like it strikes with MH/OH about 50% of the time each. The fact that there are less OH strikes in that log might just be RNG. Unless the proc works in that it hits for 50% of whichever hand got the last proc, we'll have to try and figure that out too.
- I counted 4615 physical hits that would proc the trinket (White, stormstrike, lava lash, windfury), and 2464 procs total (Anger Manifestation hits x8) which gave about a 53.4% proc rate for that log.

Also on the list, whether or not these extra hits can proc WF, Flametongue, MW stacks, and Berserking.

#575SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nevets_69
Originally Posted by Mjoedvitnir
MH [Poniard], no OH, FT Imbued. 19x Manifest Anger
World of Logs - Real Time Raid Analysis
From that last log, you landed 310 MH attacks, and landed 19 manifest anger attacks.

Looking at the buffs gained, you got 132 mote of anger, which is enough for 16 procs (with 5 leftover). I'm not sure what the discrepancy is there.

In either case, you had 325 Flametongue procs, which is more procs than you had melee swings. So I'm assuming that the proc is actually triggering flametongue.

I'm curious as to what's going on in the log that is causing the discrepancy though. Would like to see another test.

#577SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Rouncer
Thank you, that was perfect. Got enough information for it to be modeled in the sim. Here's Levva's ticket which I just edited to include the following information.

EnhSim - View Issue #5662: Add support for Tiny Abomination in a Jar proc

We now have enough testing to work up some modeling for this trinket. Here's what we know.

50% chance to proc a stack for all melee strikes - Incl Stormstrike and Lava Lash
When it hits 8 stacks it has a 50% chance to do a mainhand or an offhand melee white hit for 50% of normal damage.
The additional hits can crit and will crit as normal melee hits for 200% damage.
The additional hits proc weapon imbues (Windfury/Flametongue/Frostbrand) as if they were normal weapon strikes.
They also can proc Flurry and Unleashed Rage and Maelstrom Weapon - treat them as additional white attacks.
They will be subject to all effects that effect melee attacks - armor reduction, raid buffs and debuffs etc.
I still need someone with Black Bruise to do a bit of additional testing so I can make sure that is being modeled correctly. Looking for some testing with a fast offhand to see if it changes the general proc rate. I would like some straight autoattacking on a dummy for 2000 hits. Would also like someone to test Stormstrike to see if it is counting as 3 melee attacks instead of just two. That would be done by standing sideways to a dummy and Stormstriking till you had at least several hundred Stormstrikes (1000 would be great). Probably would be a good idea to do that testing in 4pc PvP gear for the cooldown reduction.

Thank you for all your assistance with the testing so far.
Last edited by Rouncer : 01/08/10 at 12:56 AM.

#581SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		SentinelBorg
Originally Posted by Rouncer
Thank you, that was perfect. Got enough information for it to be modeled in the sim. Here's Levva's ticket which I just edited to include the following information.

EnhSim - View Issue #5662: Add support for Tiny Abomination in a Jar proc



I still need someone with Black Bruise to do a bit of additional testing so I can make sure that is being modeled correctly. Looking for some testing with a fast offhand to see if it changes the general proc rate. I would like some straight autoattacking on a dummy for 2000 hits. Would also like someone to test Stormstrike to see if it is counting as 3 melee attacks instead of just two. That would be done by standing sideways to a dummy and Stormstriking till you had at least several hundred Stormstrikes (1000 would be great). Probably would be a good idea to do that testing in 4pc PvP gear for the cooldown reduction.

Thank you for all your assistance with the testing so far.
I would guess, that the Jar hits are yellow attacks, but I can't determine that in the posted logs, because none are versus the heroic test dummy. But if I'm right, it should be treated like a half-damage Stormstrike hit.

The ability of the Jar hits, to proc all our stuff, should make us the premium user of this trinket. We have a rather high amount of melee attacks per time (I scored ~2 hits per seconds at Saurfang this week, while our Mutilate rogues with their 62% faster weapons only got 40% more hits), while using slow hard hitting weapons in both hands.

About the triple Stormstrike effect. If we see this behavior also with Black Bruise, it could quite possibly be, that also a lot of other "on melee attack" procs including some trinkets, Berserking or even Maelstrom weapon and Windfury have this "bug".
Last edited by SentinelBorg : 01/08/10 at 4:54 AM.
#582SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
Originally Posted by SentinelBorg
About the triple Stormstrike effect. If we see this behavior also with Black Bruise, it could quite possibly be, that also a lot of other "on melee attack" procs including some trinkets, Berserking or even Maelstrom weapon and Windfury have this "bug".
It is possible that it will show up with Black Bruise considering there is a small discrepancy in the proc rate experienced for straight autoattacks and when a person is using their entire rotation. We should be careful about inferring it to occur with anything else without some evidence to the contrary.

Check out those log entries a bit more closely and you'll notice that the War Totem only gains two charges per stormstrike even while Tiny Abom gained it's impressive 3 stacks.

There is no way that this applies to Windfury Weapon, there has just been too many tests run over the years for that much of a discrepancy to have been missed. That is probably because it's effects are specific to the hand that it is applied to. That logic would also apply to the weapon enchants like berserking and mongoose. Maelstrom Weapon could probably use some additional testing however, so if someone wouldn't mind doing a sideways stormstrike series with no weapon enchants applied with either two same speed weapons or a single slow weapon (2-hander would be fine) it should be pretty easy to see if it is giving a bonus opportunity for a proc.
#583SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Lycanswift
Originally Posted by Rouncer
Raid buffed and in combat I'm floating around 3000 spellpower which means it should do about 2100 non-crit and 2520 with 2/2 Imp Fire Nova Totem. 5k crits makes it seem like it would be a button worth pressing...
I also rock between 3k and 3.2k Spellpower raid buffed and in combat. Currently I'm enjoying my Fire Nova spell critical striking for +5k. I've spec'd 2/2 imp fire nova totem and 1/1 Elemental Focus and 1/2 Imp Stormstrike to maintain Fire Nova between Shamanistic Rage CDs. I did try it, and the Glyph of Fire Nova is way overkill so I skipped that. Unfortunately I had to sacrifice Reveberation, but I'm already gemmed for Attack Power since my gear is somewhat lacking. This gives my fire nova quite a punch single target and it's devastating against multiple mobs.

Depending on the situation, Magma Totem is my first/second priority spell now (MW_5 LB/CL being the only exception)and Fire Nova directly after to get the maximum number of Novas per MT cast. Adopting this strategy was a significant DPS increase for me. I've seen my recount numbers during raids range from ~5-6k DPS on a single target to 10-11k DPS on ICC trash. Of course, it's a work-in-progress with plenty of testing to do and mostly just fun to have a different play-style that is still effective.
Last edited by Lycanswift : 01/08/10 at 11:46 AM.
#584SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Cobs
I got a BB last night. The raid went late so I didn't have tons of time to test but I will do the BB mainhand w/ flametongue, shield offhand test tonight. As for berserking, maelstrom etc. activating the proc for either BB or tiny abom I'd be surprised. The reason SS effect and flametongue have a chance to proc is that behaviour is mor in line with ret pallies' observations on Bryntroll's effects (I.e attacks that placed debuffs on the target along with regular or special melee attacks) and not attacks that placed a buff on ourselves. Still owrth testing but it would be counter intuitive. Also Bryntroll was nerfed for ret pallies and unholy DKs to only proc on straight melee hits so it is possible this change also happened for BB or can in the future.

#587SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3◊ Shaker
Rouncer - running your slow/fast test right now - will have results in what, a half hour or so.

Using MH BB, OH 1.5 white POS vendor fist weapon, autoattack only, no proc'd haste besides flurry.
#588SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
Originally Posted by Shaker
Rouncer - running your slow/fast test right now - will have results in what, a half hour or so.

Using MH BB, OH 1.5 white POS vendor fist weapon, autoattack only, no proc'd haste besides flurry.
Perfect, thank you.

After we get that we should be good for both the BB and the Tiny Abom for at least a little while. What we will want after that is for people to start comparing their Sim results with the weapons to what they are seeing in game.

Best fights for that are Festergut and Saurfang, provided you are staying in melee range for the entire encounter. Saurfang should be perfect for that (except for the short length of the encounter) because none of the ancillary damage to blood beasts from Fire Nova, Magma and Chain Lightning should have any effect on the dps shown by Necrotic Touch and Manifest Anger. Because of the short durations you should expect some variation from the sim, the question is going to be one of significance.

Easiest way to deal with this is going to be for people to post very specific information for others to gather. Sim out your set for that fight with the combat duration set to within 0.25 of a minute (15 seconds - 3:17 = 3.25) from your actual parse. Variance should be set to 0% and run the sim for 5000 hours. Then break it down as follows and people can start comparing results. After a week or two we should have enough data to see if we need to tweak the simulators settings.

*Link to the WoL parse*

Overall DPS
Simulator - XXXX.XX
Combat Parse - XXXX.XX

Necrotic Touch 
Simulator Uptime - XX.X%
Combat Parse Uptime - XX.X%

Simulator DPS - XXX.XX
Combat Parse DPS - XXX.XX

Tiny Abom
Simulator - Manifest Anger DPS - XXX.XX
Combat Parse - Manifest Anger DPS - XXX.XX

Simulator MW procs (PPM x combat duration) - XXX
Combat Parse MW procs - XXX
Try to stick to that format so it will be easy to compare the results and try to log out in the gear/spec/glyphs you were wearing when the parse was made so we can load you up in Rawr from the Armory to verify your simulator results.


*******Please post the comparisons in the EnhSim Thread*******


That way we can keep the testing consolidated in one thread and stick to discussing the results/mechanics here.

Let's try to keep the discussion of the mechanics in the EnhSim thread so people won't be confused trying to follow so many separate threads on the same topic.

#592SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Dacheflol
When it hits 8 stacks it has a 50% chance to do a mainhand or an offhand melee style hit for 50% of normal damage.
from rogue forum:
Whichever weapon procs the first mote determines which attack will occur.
Combat and Mutilate Spreadsheets (Updated for 3.3)

#593SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Rouncer
Can Flametongue proc a stack? Please repeat your Lava Lash test with Flametongue imbued to test if you can get 2 stacks off a Lava Lash and FT proc.

Berserking proccing it will have to be added to the sim as will the weapon priority aspect but before we get him messing with the code it would be helpful to figure out about FT as that would be a truly significant change.


(edit)

Also because this trinket is so hard to accurately model I'm going to ask for something I normally wouldn't. I want comparison between the Tiny Abom and other trinkets where we already know exactly how good they are. Here are the "rules" for such testing.

Level 80 dummy - no debuffs or buffs applied except for JoW if you can find a way to have that available.
WF/FT
Totems dropped - WF/SoE/Mana Spring/Magma
Only one trinket equipped but everything else should be your normal raid kit.
10 minute parses - try to maintain normal priorities for each parse
One series with a [Mirror of Truth] - you can sell it back after so it won't cost anything
One series with [Tiny Abomination in a Jar]
If possible - one series with [Herkuml War Token]
Finally one series with no trinkets equipped.

After you are done with your series load your profile into Rawr and export into EnhSim first with no trinkets and then with Mirror, then with Herkuml and finally with Comet's Trail.

Recount will be considered sufficient for this testing - this is just to get people information about the trinket so they can make an informed decision about it's value to know whether to just pass to a rogue or whether to roll/spend DKP on it.

Reasoning for Mirror of Truth is that it is a known quantity.

Format for results should take the form of;

Dummy no trinket - XXXXdps
Dummy with Mirror - XXXXdps
Dummy with Tiny Abom - XXXXdps
Dummy with Herkuml - XXXXdps
Sim no trinkets - XXXXdps
Sim with Mirror - XXXXdps
Sim with Herkuml - XXXXdps
Sim with Comet's Trail - XXXXdps
Last edited by Rouncer : 01/10/10 at 12:25 PM.

#596SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
Rava, if you have a chance would you mind picking up a [Mirror of Truth] and repeating the same tests, sim and dummy, you did for Tiny Abom?

Looking at the parse it does confirm Flametongue, it's procs don't proc additional motes, and the numbers are very consistent with how we have the sim set up to model the Tiny Abom as well as being consistent to your sim output.

For now it's looking pretty safe to say that Enh Shaman should pass on the Tiny Abom to Rogues for now. It's a minor upgrade for us over things like the [Needle-Encrusted Scorpion] and [Blood of the Old God] for us while it is their BiS for Mut spec and really, really, *really* good for them in general.

BTW it wasn't your computer that hated the WOL client, mine didn't like that parse either. You left a big space at the top of the file when you manually trimmed it. The log looks for a time/date stamp right at the very begining and threw an error when it wasn't there. Just deleting that space so that the time/date stamp is right at the top fixed the issue.

However I do agree with you that currently the 264 version should be skipped by all enhancement shamans as it was showing up as one of the worst trinkets for us with currently available gear but is BIS for other classes.

#599SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nevets_69
Originally Posted by Ryethe
Keep in mind that Abom in a Jar scales. As you get more gear it gets better. With the sim using 264 gear I couldn't get it to be worthwhile, but once I moved up to 277 gear with the 277 Abom suddenly it was BIS.
I want to echo this, as I found the same thing. But the effect was less about the trinket scaling (even though it does, and well at that) and more about my BiS setup reaching the crit cap.

Candidates for BiS trinkets are [Herkuml War Token], [Whispering Fanged Skull], [Deathbringer's Will] and [Tiny Abomination in a Jar]; with an outside chance that [Death's Choice] and [Comet's Trail] could still be good.

What I found while I was building my own BiS set, that I couldn't afford to use WFS, or DBW, or even DC because of the large amounts of crit that gets wasted with these trinkets. Combine that with the fact that TAiaJ adds a lot of additional hit that pushes back the crit cap rather significantly, and it worked out to a BiS item.

Also, if you're not using TAiaJ, then you should seriously consider gemming hit (even past the cap) for some significant DPS boosts to your theorized BiS kit. The crit cap is a major concern for us in T10 gear (I'm running into it even now in 258 T9 gear), and should be something that every shaman is taking into account.

I wrote myself a macro that tells me how much room I have left to the crit cap so that I can test it in raids with full buffs and everything proc'd.

/script DEFAULT_CHAT_FRAME:AddMessage("Room below crit cap: "..100-GetCritChance()-(27-(GetCombatRatingBonus(6)+6))-4.8-24)
The macro assumes that you are dual wielding, and have 3/3 Dual Wield Spec, and fighting a level 83 boss mob. The last two numbers in the macro account for the 4.8% unavoidable miss chance on bosses, and the 24% chance for glancing blows.
#600SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3

Useful macro. I'm thinking that adding this feature to ShockAndAwe might be useful. Ie: I'd get ShockAndAwe to add an extra line to the crit tooltip on your paperdoll. With that text or warning about over crit cap. That way users don't need to remember the macro they just mouseover their crit value in game to check.

Edit: Can someone send me a Rawr XML showing their character at the crit cap so I can verify Rawr is correctly modelling this.

#603SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
Tiny Abom - with the sim update to include Berserking and proper modeling of Stormstrike, it's now showing up as a decent alternative to the big three. Those being Whispering Fanged Skull, Comet's Trail and Deathbringer's Will.

War Token beats them all by a significant margin. It even beats all the heroic ones, so it should definitely be occupying one of your trinket slots. As for the other one, if you have a Comet's Trail or a Whispering Fanged Skull or a Deathbringer's Will then you should still pass on the Tiny Abom but if you don't then it certainly would be worth picking up.

#608SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3gunsmithx

#609SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rouncer
Originally Posted by gunsmithx
So it seems rogues are saying Tiny abom isn't procing off posions anymore, has anyone seen any changes in how it works for us?
From what I've been hearing the changes effects on us should be pretty minimal. It will only have 2 chances to proc per Stormstrike instead of three, as it won't be able to proc from the debuff application anymore. Also it won't be proccing from Berserking or Mongoose anymore.
#610SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Ryethe
Originally Posted by Rouncer
From what I've been hearing the changes effects on us should be pretty minimal. It will only have 2 chances to proc per Stormstrike instead of three, as it won't be able to proc from the debuff application anymore. Also it won't be proccing from Berserking or Mongoose anymore.
Still needs to be tested though as there isn't a ton of consistency with the change. The rets are reporting that they are still getting a possible 3 motes per attack (down from what was 5 before):
1 for the melee attack, 1 for the SoV stack increasing/refreshing, and 1 from the holy damage component of the SoV proc.

So it's possible we may still get a mote from SS application.

#612SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Cobs
This came up in the BiS thread regarding our rotation list. Basically people were seeing a DPS increase dropping FE in the rotation and someone responded this was due to a ramp up in our AP (and thus SP) giving the FE more damage over its duration if it is casted a few seconds into fight.

In terms of a "best practices" approach to dropping the totem, what are the buffs we want to have up before using it? Off the top of my head we would wait for;

20 stacks of war totem
After the first mw5 (with 2t10)
Berserking
Quaking earth or 3 stacks of avalanche
Unleashed rage (should be up regardless)
SoE totem (should be up as well but if you are dropping all 4 totems at once the buff might not apply before SoE)
Any ap trinket procs or on-uses.

I tried searching Curse but it is hard to search by add-on function. Does anoyne know of an addon that can show current values of stats? I'm thinking a little window in the corner of my screen showing either current AP or SP. Also has there been any research into the FE's scaling coefficients? It seems it's implemented in the sim so there should be some information somewhere but a quick google didn't find anything.

#614SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Levva
To see the data on the Fire elemental goto the sim wiki and view the closed issues. Its all there.

The fire elemental is a Guardian not a pet, and so gets co-efficients of your AP & SP at the point it is summoned - fluctuations in your AP & SP after its summoned and any buffs etc have no effect on it at all. Hence the idea of maxing your stats before you summon it.

As for showing the stats I've toyed with the idea of having a stats frame for this purpose in ShockAndAwe. Its a low priority addition though.
#615SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3SentinelBorg
Originally Posted by Levva
To see the data on the Fire elemental goto the sim wiki and view the closed issues. Its all there.

The fire elemental is a Guardian not a pet, and so gets co-efficients of your AP & SP at the point it is summoned - fluctuations in your AP & SP after its summoned and any buffs etc have no effect on it at all. Hence the idea of maxing your stats before you summon it.

As for showing the stats I've toyed with the idea of having a stats frame for this purpose in ShockAndAwe. Its a low priority addition though.
You could add a threshold value of AP or SP, that the user could define and that needs to be reached before FE shows up in the Priority frame.
#616SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Telumehtar
Not sure what the enhsim is going to say given various mixes of people's gear and the assumption that most sims are done with a stable target where attacks are from behind and near constant, but I will say from personal logs, I found the loss of the increased shock damage from 4pc T9 (in conjunction with dropping Flame Shock glyph) when I went to 2pc/2pc set up was VERY noticable on movement heavy fights (which is most of them in ICC).

Unless you can pop ShamRage on cooldown and make use of the full 15 seconds of the buff, the minimal stat gain from the armor alone (I upgraded gauntlets and Shoulders first) was not sufficient to offset the loss of shock damage. I returned to 4pc T9 and the Flame Shock glyph, and saw my figures improve immediately. I personally will be waiting to make the switch over to T10 when I have the 4pc bonus.

Keep in mind I would not be surprised if EnhSim shows an increase in DPS, but what happens in Sim is rarely what happens in practice, and the nature of the bonuses lends T9 more flexibility in movement heavy fights. Hence I highly recommend you run logs through a full raid, under each configuration and decide for yourself how the performance is handling.
#617SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Ryethe
Originally Posted by Telumehtar
Not sure what the enhsim is going to say given various mixes of people's gear and the assumption that most sims are done with a stable target where attacks are from behind and near constant, but I will say from personal logs, I found the loss of the increased shock damage from 4pc T9 (in conjunction with dropping Flame Shock glyph) when I went to 2pc/2pc set up was VERY noticable on movement heavy fights (which is most of them in ICC).

#619SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Telumehtar

Agreed, 2Pc-T10-SR in conjunction with other additive effects might sway things a bit. From a purist perspective, EnhSim should answer much of that. My concern will be how it moves to practice given that SR also serves 2 other functions for us, namely, a mana regen, and in a pinch a damage mitigator. The beauty of the 4pc T9 is it simply works all the time. No thought or careful planning required. To maximize 2pc T10 however could require a bit of planning, and even a little luck(RNGs with trinkets etc).
